avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is moderate above 2200 metres and low below.
The main problem is old snow. In the north-west to north-east sector, slab avalanches can be triggered in some places by even a small additional load. Avalanches can occasionally be of medium size if the snow thickness is sufficient.
Small sliding snow avalanches can occur spontaneously above 1800 metres.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Be aware of the problem of old snow at high altitudes

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snow surface is often still loose at high altitudes. In the central part of the snowpack, weak layers of angular crystals have formed between the fresh snow packs of the past week. In small areas, surface frost may also have been snowed in.
On the sunny side, the snow cover has settled well up to high altitudes and is partly sliding on steep, smooth slopes.

tendency.highlights: The problem of old snow at altitude remains.

weatherForecast.comment:
On Sunday, it will be sunny until midday and visibility will be very good. In the afternoon, increasingly dense clouds will gather. The wind will be light at best. At 2000 metres it will be -1 to +2 degrees, at 3000 metres around -5 degrees.
In the night to Monday and until Monday morning it will rain and snow a little from dense clouds (snow line around 1100 m). A few centimetres of fresh snow will accumulate in the northern Alps, where clouds will dominate. In the Tauern region, the precipitation will remain unproductive and the sun will shine in the afternoon. The wind will be mostly light. At 2000 m -4 to 0 degrees, at 3000 m around -8 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is moderate above 2200 metres and low below.
The main problem is old snow. In the sectors from north-west to north to north-east, slab avalanches can be triggered in some places by even a small additional load. Avalanches can break through to deeper weak layers and become medium sized if the snow is thick enough.
Small to medium-sized slab avalanches can also be triggered in fresh drift snow at a few danger spots, especially near the crest. Below 2800 m, mainly small sliding snow avalanches can be triggered spontaneously.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Slab avalanches, especially in the northern sector

snowpackStructure.comment:
The snow surface is often still loose at high altitudes. In the upper part of the snowpack, fresh snow that has blown over close to the crest can form a weak layer. In the middle part of the snowpack, weak layers of angular crystals have formed between the fresh snow packs of the past week.
At high altitudes, angular crystals can also be found at the transition to the compact old snow foundation and occasionally near the ground.
On the sunny side, the snow cover has settled well up to high altitudes and can slide off the ground.

tendency.highlights: The old snow problem remains, the drift snow problem decreases as the snow cover settles.

weatherForecast.comment:
On Sunday, it will be sunny until midday and visibility will be very good. In the afternoon, increasingly dense clouds will gather. The wind will be light at best. At 2000 metres it will be -1 to +2 degrees, at 3000 metres around -5 degrees.
In the night to Monday and until Monday morning it will rain and snow a little from dense clouds (snow line around 1100 m). A few centimetres of fresh snow will fall in the northern Alps, but the precipitation will be light in the Tauern region. In the afternoon, the sun will shine in the Tauern region, but there will still be a lot of residual clouds in the northern Alps. The wind will be mostly light. At 2000 m -4 to 0 degrees, at 3000 m around -8 degrees.

avalancheActivity.comment:
The avalanche danger is low, the main danger is drift snow.
Above 2000 m, small slab avalanches can be triggered in a few places in west, north and east exposures.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Little snow, small drift snow problem

snowpackStructure.comment: The snow surface is wind-treated. In the upper part of the snow cover, overblown fresh snow can form a weak layer. Overall, there is still little snow.

tendency.highlights: Little change, the drift snow is increasingly settling.

weatherForecast.comment:
On Sunday, it will be sunny until midday and visibility will be very good. In the afternoon, increasingly dense clouds will gather. The wind will be light at most. At 2000 metres it will be -1 to +2 degrees.
On Monday, clouds will dominate at first, but there will be hardly any precipitation. In the afternoon, the clouds will clear, the sun will prevail and visibility will improve. The wind will be mostly light. At 2000 m -3 to -1 degrees.

ALBINA.generalHeadline: Old snow problem in the northern sector
